author: AFP
title: Victor Wembanyama sufre trombosis y se pierde toda la temporada con los Spurs; esa enfermedad retiró a Chris Bosh
text:
El prodigio francés Victor Wembanyama se perderá el resto de la temporada 2024-2025 de la NBA debido a una trombosis venosa profunda en el hombro derecho, anunció este jueves su equipo, San Antonio Spurs.
Wembanyama, de 21 años, principal figura del equipo texano, fue diagnosticado con la dolencia, que puso fin a la carrera del histórico Chris Bosh (dos veces ganador de la NBA con el Heat) después de su participación en el Juego de las Estrellas de la NBA el fin de semana.
"Brindaremos actualizaciones (sobre su estado de salud) cuando sea apropiado", añade el comunicado publicado en redes sociales por los Spurs.
En la 2024-2025, su segunda temporada en la NBA, 'Wemby' ha disputado 46 partidos con promedio de 24,3 puntos, 11 rebotes y 3,7 asistencias por encuentro.
Su último partido de la presente temporada fue la derrota 116-113 de los Spurs ante los Boston Celtics el 12 de febrero, en el que Wembanyama anotó 17 puntos y 13 rebotes.
El francés, ganador de la medalla de plata en los Juegos Olímpicos de París-2024, fue nombrado Novato del Año de la NBA la pasada temporada.
'Wemby', para muchos considerado el "futuro de la NBA", participó por primera vez en el Juego de las Estrellas el fin de semana pasado.
Un reporte de la cadena ESPN indica que la expectativa de los Spurs es que pueda estar en condiciones de regresar a la competencia para la próxima campaña de la NBA.
— San Antonio Spurs (@spurs)[February 20, 2025]
"Perdemos parte importante": Chris Paul
"Sabemos que perdemos parte importante de nuestro equipo", dijo Chris Paul. "Fuera de su talento, su carisma y lo que brinda al vestuario es lo que más vamos a entrañar".
"Entendemos que tenemos un trabajo por hacer pero nos preocupamos por nuestra gente", agregó el base; la Federación Francesa de Basquetbol dijo estar al tanto de la situación y en contacto con el cuerpo médico de los Spurs
"Sé cuánto ama jugar y lo difícil que será estar fuera por mucho tiempo", expresó Boris Diaw, quien se coronó campeón de la NBA con los Spurs y ahora es director general del seleccionado francés.
A la ausencia de Wembanyama en los Spurs se suma la de su entrenador, Gregg Popovich, quien sufrió un derrame cerebral el 2 de noviembre del 2024 y desde entonces se mantiene en recuperación.
Con la llegada de De'Aaron Fox previo en el mercado de pases invernal, los Spurs completaron un trío junto al experimentado Chris Paul y Wembanyama con el que tenían la esperanza de clasificar a los playoffs.
Actualmente, los Spurs marchan en el puesto doce de la Conferencia Oeste con una diferencia de cuatro juegos con respecto al último cupo de clasificación a la postemporada.

author: gloslivenews@reachplc.com (Phil Norris)
title: Post-Christmas crime spree sees presents stolen from church and cars
text:
While most of us exchanged gifts and showed kindness to fellow human beings, others went out to steal stuff from others. A series of post-Christmas
crimes saw people take presents meant for other people.
Even a church was not off-limits as a church in
Gloucester was targeted by thieves who made off with presents, an electric keyboard and a mixing deck. While presents were also stolen from a car in Cheltenham.
Gloucestershire police have issued a number of
Community Alerts about the crimes in the hope of spreading warnings about not leaving valuables in cars. There is also the hope that people may have information to help catch those responsible for ruining Christmas for the victims.
READ MORE:
Met Office gives its verdict on 15-day 'snow bomb' set to hit UK
READ MORE:
Massive scorpion found in Cotswolds village
Below, you can see some of the crimes listed by police. If you wish to update police on an incident or tell them about an existing case visit
here, to report a crime visit here.
List of crimes
A vehicle has been entered by unknown means, an untidy search has taken place and bags of presents left in the boot have been stolen including, a blue Trespass backpack, tortilla press, a jumper, toy cars and items of clothing. The incident happened in White Cross Square, Cheltenham between 12pm and 5pm on Tuesday, December 26. Incident 250 of 26/12/2023.
Two suspects have used what is possibly a crowbar to force open a church door to gain access, they have then kicked open an office door. Offenders have stolen items including an electric keyboard, a mixing desk and some Christmas presents. The incident happened in Stroud Road, Gloucester, at 6.30am on Sunday, December 24. Incident 087 of 26/12/2023.
The back passenger window of a vehicle has been smashed and items including roughly £30 cash, two Nike jackets and some Apple AirPods have been stolen. Incident in India Road, Gloucester, between 12.30am on Monday, December 25 and 10am on Tuesday, December 26. Incident 082 on 26/12/2023.
An unknown male has entered an unlocked vehicle and stolen a wallet containing approximately £00 cash and bank cards. Incident in Spring Lane, Stroud, at 4.44am on 26/12/2023. Incident 095 of 26/12/2023.
A male wearing a black Under Armour coat, blue and red hoodie and white trainers can be seen on CCTV using a crowbar to break into an outbuilding. The offender removed the door and stole an amount of alcohol stored in the building. The offender was on a pushbike and had a dog with him. Incident in Vale Road, Bishop's Cleeve, between 8.30pm on Sunday, December 24 and 9am on Wednesday, December 27). Incident 093 of 27/12/2023.
Unknown offenders have gained access to a business premises by climbing through a rear window. Till drawer and housing have been stolen and an unknown amount of cash. Incident in Rotunda Terrace, Cheltenham, at around 9.03pm on Tuesday, December 26. Incident 301 of 26/12/2023.
Offenders have gained access to a property by unknown means, possibly picking a lock as no sign of forced entry. Offenders have turned lights on and searched the property. Three high-value watches and an amount of jewellery have been stolen. Incident in Imperial Square, Cheltenham, on Tuesday, December 26. Incident 074 of 26/12/2023.
Offenders have smashed the passenger window of a vehicle parked on the road. Presents left on the rear seat have been stolen, items including a jewellery box, Puma trainers, white gold earrings and bath products. Incident in Crescent Place, Cheltenham, between 6.30pm on Tuesday, December 26 and 7.30am on Wednesday, December 27. Incident 062 of 27/12/2023.
Want our best stories with fewer ads and alerts when the biggest news stories drop? Download our app on
iPhone or Android and comment on this story.

author: CNN
title: More monster waves will collide with the California coast after injuring onlookers and causing serious flooding
text:
More monster waves will collide with the California coast after injuring onlookers and causing serious flooding
CNN, KCAL, KCBS
By Elizabeth Wolfe, Robert Shackelford, Mary Gilbert and Cindy Von Quednow, CNN
(CNN) — A series of powerful storms in the Pacific Ocean are
driving towering waves into the California coastline, triggering flooding and posing a significant risk to people and structures along the coast.
Monstrous, 20-foot-plus waves on Thursday crashed over seawalls and swept away and injured several people, forced rescues and sent a damaging surge of water through coastal California streets.
A brief dip in wave heights may occur in some locations along the California coast during the daytime Friday as one storm pushes ashore, but the danger will quickly ramp back up later Friday and Saturday as another system develops behind it.
“Overall, this is expected to be an exceptional high-surf and coastal flooding event that has not occurred in many years,” the weather service in Los Angeles warned.
Sea levels have risen along most of the California coastline over the past century, NOAA data shows, as global temperature climbs and melts glaciers and ice sheets. Higher sea levels are making coastal flooding events worse and will continue to do so in the future.
Waves as high as telephone poles – about 40 feet – could slam into San Francisco through Friday morning. Fifteen- to 20-foot waves are expected along the central and Southern California coasts through Saturday evening.
The first round of dangerous waves hit alongside high tide Thursday morning. Several people were injured by a huge wave that slammed into Ventura Beach.
The wave crashed over a barrier along the Southern California beach, tossing a wall of fast-moving water at a group of onlookers who rushed to escape the deluge, witness video shows. Seawater quickly knocked some people off their feet and pummeled cars as drivers tried to speed away.
Nearly 20 people were briefly swept away in the incident and eight people were taken to the hospital, Ventura officials said.
High water and dangerous rip currents will churn along some of California’s beaches through the weekend as much of the West coast – spanning from the US-Mexico border to southern Oregon – is under coastal flood and high-surf alerts, the National Weather Service said.
The dangerous conditions pose an “exceptional risk” of ocean drowning and damage to structures like piers and jetties, the National Weather Service said.
The dangerous wave risk will lessen on Saturday for Northern California, but continue in southern Oregon and rival Thursday’s impact in Southern California. The Ventura County coast, along with Hermosa, Manhattan and Palos Verdes beaches face the most extreme surf and are at risk for significant coastal flooding.
One of the storms helping to drive the waves will also bring rain and wind to California through Saturday. High wind alerts are in effect for California’s central coast and the Bay Area on Friday as wind gusts of up to 50 mph are expected. These strong wind gusts will churn up waters even further.
The spectacular waters have enthralled some surfers and onlookers, but weather officials are cautioning that the waves and strong rip tides can be perilous for those nearby.
“Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore,” the National Weather Service warned.
At least one fisherman fell overboard in a harbor off Oxnard Thursday and later came ashore uninjured, the Ventura County Fire Department said.
The conditions caused some road closures and evacuations in coastal California communities Thursday and prompted the rescue of five campers along the San Luis Obispo coast.
Crews in Ventura worked through the night to reinforce a mile-long sand barrier that was damaged by powerful waters on Thursday, the local fire department said. Standing about 7 feet tall, the raised wall helps protect beachside communities.
Hoping to discourage spectators, local officials closed a main access point to Ventura Pier, which saw a swell of about 20 feet on Thursday. Some coastal streets in the area have also been closed as a precaution.
In central California’s Santa Cruz, the sheriff’s office
issued an evacuation warning for some areas on Thursday, which included areas of Rio Del Mar, where seawater filled beachside roadways and pushed against some homes, CNN affiliate KION reported. The warnings were lifted later in the day.
Massive waves attract surfers to Mavericks
Despite safety warnings, the massive waves are a welcome sight to surfers hungry to tackle the legendary swells at Mavericks Beach, about 25 miles south of San Francisco.
Pro surfers and spectators flocked to the beach on Thursday for a competition at the site known for having
some of the biggest waves in the world, CNN affiliate KGO reported.
Local resident Ion Banner
told the affiliate that surfers from Brazil, Tahiti and Hawaii were out in the water. “It’s pretty gnarly, it’s super big,” he said.
“The waves looked absolutely massive and it was everything that we expected,” said Miguel Blanco, who told KGO he flew in from Portugal to surf the waves. “It was really big, I’d say 40-60 foot waves.”
Mavericks’ jaw-dropping waves – caused by unique underwater rock formations – reach their biggest heights in the winter, when big wave surfers from all over the world make pilgrimages to face the swells.
The legendary waves and the surfers who brave them have been the subject of several films and documentaries, including the 2012 biopic “Chasing Mavericks” about American surfer Jay Moriarity’s journey to surf Mavericks as a teen.
On Thursday, the conditions were prime for surfers like Blanco.
“If it’s your turn, you just gotta go,” Blanco said. “When you see a big wave, you’re kinda scared but at the same time you’re feeling like you should go and you just go and enjoy the ride.”
CNN’s David Williams contributed to this report.
The-CNN-Wire
™ & © 2023 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. All rights reserved.

author: VNExplorer
title: Corte declara inadmisible recurso de Daniel Jadue para revocar su prisión preventiva
text: Corte declara inadmisible recurso de Daniel Jadue para revocar su prisión preventiva La Corte de Apelaciones de Santiago declaró inadmisible un recurso de amparo ingresado a favor del alcalde de Recoleta, Daniel Jadue, buscando revocar su prisión preventiva. Recordemos que el jefe comunal cumple prisión preventiva en el recinto penitenciario Capitán Yáber, desde el lunes recién pasado. Luego de que fue formalizado por delitos de estafa, cohecho y fraude al fisco, en el marco del caso Farmacias Populares. El recurso en cuestión fue ingresado por Julio Cesar Cuadros, en calidad de ciudadano. Quien buscaba dejar sin efecto la resolución de la prisión preventiva contra Jadue, decretada el pasado lunes por el Tercer Juzgado de Garantía. Según el pronunciamiento en el tribunal de alzada, “nuestro ordenamiento jurídico contempla un régimen recursivo específico respecto de la resolución que decreta la prisión preventiva, estableciendo en el artículo 149 del Código Procesal Penal, la procedencia de un recurso de apelación”.

author: Lindsay Weber
title: Man accused of starting Park Fire pleads not guilty
text:
Search location by ZIP code ZIP Advertisement Park Fire: Man accused of starting California's 4th largest wildfire pleads not guilty Share Copy Link Copy {copyShortcut} to copy Link copied! Updated: 5:32 PM PDT Aug 22, 2024 Lindsay Weber Digital producer Orko Manna Reporter Park Fire: Man accused of starting California's 4th largest wildfire pleads not guilty Share Copy Link Copy {copyShortcut} to copy Link copied! Updated: 5:32 PM PDT Aug 22, 2024 HURT. THE MAN ACCUSED OF STARTING THE PARK FIRE WAS BACK IN COURT THIS AFTERNOON. HE’S CHARGED WITH ARSON FOR ALLEGEDLY PUSHING A BURNING CAR DOWN AN EMBANKMENT NEAR UPPER BIDWELL PARK IN LATE JULY. PROSECUTORS SAY THAT’S WHAT CAUSED THE FLAMES TO SPREAD. KCRA 3’S ORKO MANNA IS AT BUTTE COUNTY COURTHOUSE RIGHT NOW. SO, ORKO, WHAT HAPPENED AT TODAY’S ARRAIGNMENT? AFTER WEEKS OF CONSULTING WITH HIS PUBLIC DEFENDER THIS AFTERNOON, RONNIE DEAN START PLEADED NOT GUILTY TO THE ARSON CHARGES AGAINST HIM HERE INSIDE BUTTE COUNTY SUPERIOR COURT. HE’S ACCUSED OF STARTING THE PARK FIRE. THE FOURTH LARGEST WILDFIRE IN CALIFORNIA HISTORY. AS I MENTIONED, STOUT WAS INSIDE THE COURTROOM. HE WAS WEARING A GREEN SHIRT AS I MENTIONED. HE PLEADED NOT GUILTY TO STARTING THE PARK FIRE. THE DEFENSE SAYS THAT THEY HAVE SOME EVIDENCE THAT THEY BELIEVE SHOWS STOUT DID NOT INTEND TO START THE FIRE. STOUT FACES ONE COUNT OF FELONY ARSON, WHICH IS CONSIDERED WILLFUL AND MALICIOUS. AND THERE’S ALSO A LESSER COUNT OF RECKLESS ARSON AGAINST HIM. PROSECUTORS SAY STOUT WAS DRUNK ON JULY 24TH WHEN HE DROVE HIS CAR ONTO A BERM AND GOT STUCK NEAR UPPER BIDWELL PARK. THEY CLAIM WHEN STOUT REVVED THE ENGINE OVER THE DRY GRASS, IT SPARKED A FIRE AND THEN HE ALLEGEDLY PUSHED THE CAR DOWN AN EMBANKMENT. ACCORDING TO A WITNESS, LIVECOPTER3 CAPTURING VIDEO FROM THE AIR OF THAT VEHICLE. WHILE NEITHER, NEITHER SIDE HAS A COPY OF CAL FIRE’S REPORT, THE PROSECUTION SAYS THEY’RE USING SEARCH WARRANTS AND ARREST WARRANTS TO MAKE THEIR CASE. THE DEFENSE SAYS THEY’RE CONSTANTLY GETTING MATERIALS REGARDING THIS CASE, SO THEY NEED MORE TIME TO GO THROUGH SOME OF THAT, THE JUDGE AGREES. STOUT IS EXPECTED TO BE BACK IN COURT ON SEPTEMBER 19TH FOR A SETTING DATE, WHICH WILL DETERMINE WHEN THE PRELIMINARY HEARING WILL TAKE PLACE. REPORTING FROM BUTTE COUNTY, ORKO MANNA KCRA THREE NEWS. THANK YOU. ORKO STOUT HAS TWO PRIOR FELONY CONVICTIONS IN CALIFORNIA FOR CHILD MOLESTATION AND ROBBERY. SO IF HE IS CONVICTED OF ARSON, THAT WOULD B GET LOCAL BREAKING NEWS ALERTS The latest breaking updates, delivered straight to your email inbox.
Your Email Address Submit Privacy Notice Advertisement Park Fire: Man accused of starting California's 4th largest wildfire pleads not guilty Share Copy Link Copy {copyShortcut} to copy Link copied! Updated: 5:32 PM PDT Aug 22, 2024 Lindsay Weber Digital producer Orko Manna Reporter A man accused of sparking California's fourth largest wildfire returned to a Butte County courtroom on Thursday, pleading not guilty.Ronnie Dean Stout II, 42, was seen pushing a burning car into a gully near the Alligator Hole in upper Bidwell Park on July 24, sparking what has become known as the Park Fire, the Butte County District Attorney's Office said.Nearly a month after it started, the Park Fire has burned at least 429,460 acres across Butte, Tehama, Shasta and Plumas counties. More than 637 structures were destroyed and 49 others damaged, according to Cal Fire. All evacuation orders and warnings have been lifted.Stout appeared for his arraignment for arson on Thursday. During the hearing, he pleaded not guilty. Stout's public defender said that she believes they have some evidence to refute the claims that Stout intended to start the fire.In a previous court hearing, Stout claimed he didn't start the fire on purpose and denied pushing the flaming car down a gully. Stout also has two previous "strike" convictions, according to the DA's office. One was for lewd and lascivious acts with a child under 14 in 2001 in Butte County. The other was for robbery with great bodily injury in 2002 in Kern County. After that second conviction, he was sentenced to state prison for 20 years.On Thursday, the defense asked for more time before a preliminary hearing to review evidence and discovery materials.During this most recent court session, the prosecution also said that neither side has a Cal Fire report on the fire. He explained that is usually takes months for them to compile their entire reports. For now, the prosecution is using information from search warrants and arrest warrants to make their case.A judge scheduled the next court hearing for Sept. 19. During that hearing, the court will set the date for Stout's preliminary hearing. The judge also ordered that Stout would remain in police custody.See more coverage of top California stories here | Download our app | Subscribe to our morning newsletter BUTTE VALLEY, Calif. — A man accused of sparking California's fourth largest wildfire returned to a Butte County courtroom on Thursday, pleading not guilty.
Ronnie Dean Stout II, 42, was seen pushing a burning car into a gully near the Alligator Hole in upper Bidwell Park on July 24, sparking what has become known as the Park Fire , the Butte County District Attorney's Office said.
Advertisement Nearly a month after it started, the Park Fire has burned at least 429,460 acres across Butte, Tehama, Shasta and Plumas counties. More than 637 structures were destroyed and 49 others damaged, according to Cal Fire. All evacuation orders and warnings have been lifted.
Stout appeared for his arraignment for arson on Thursday. During the hearing, he pleaded not guilty. Stout's public defender said that she believes they have some evidence to refute the claims that Stout intended to start the fire.
In a previous court hearing , Stout claimed he didn't start the fire on purpose and denied pushing the flaming car down a gully.
Stout also has two previous "strike" convictions, according to the DA's office. One was for lewd and lascivious acts with a child under 14 in 2001 in Butte County. The other was for robbery with great bodily injury in 2002 in Kern County. After that second conviction, he was sentenced to state prison for 20 years.
On Thursday, the defense asked for more time before a preliminary hearing to review evidence and discovery materials.
During this most recent court session, the prosecution also said that neither side has a Cal Fire report on the fire. He explained that is usually takes months for them to compile their entire reports. For now, the prosecution is using information from search warrants and arrest warrants to make their case.
A judge scheduled the next court hearing for Sept. 19. During that hearing, the court will set the date for Stout's preliminary hearing. The judge also ordered that Stout would remain in police custody.

author: Asian News International
title: Trending: Rajinikanth Offers Prayers At Kedarnath And Badrinath Shrines
text: The image was shared on X. (courtesy: Dineshk67162222 ) Megastar Rajinikanth paid a sacred visit to the Kedarnath Dham and Badrinath Dham in Uttarakhand. In the visuals obtained by ANI, Rajinikanth can be seen offering prayers at the temple. After arriving in Dehradun earlier, Rajinikanth expressed excitement about his spiritual trips. He said, "Every year I used to get new experience that made me continue my spiritual journey again and again. I believe even this time, (I) will get new experiences." He shared that such sacred trips help him grow. Rajinikanth also spoke about why spirituality is important. "The whole world needs spirituality, as it's important for every human being. Being spiritual means experiencing peace and tranquillity, and fundamentally, it involves believing in God." Recently, Rajinikanth visited the BAPS Hindu Mandir in Abu Dhabi. Videos and pictures of Rajinikanth seeking blessing at the temple were posted on the official social media account of the BAPS Hindu Mandir. Rajinikanth was granted the golden visa by UAE's Department of Culture and Tourism. On the acting front, Rajinikanth has completed the shoot of his upcoming movie Vettaiyan , directed by TJ Gnanavel. Vettaiyan also stars Amitabh Bachchan. Promoted Listen to the latest songs, only on JioSaavn.com Vettaiyan , which is Rajinikanth's 170th film, is scheduled for a worldwide release in October this year. Earlier this month, Rajinikanth and Amitabh were seen filming a few scenes together in Mumbai. (Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)

author: @wcjb20
title: No increased costs for patients in new UF Health-United Healthcare deal, officials say
text:
No increased costs for patients in new UF Health-United Healthcare deal, officials say
GAINESVILLE, Fla. (WCJB) - UF Health patients with United Healthcare should not see any increased costs passed on to them after a new agreement was reached.
The new 18-month health insurance agreement has a built-in renewal and eliminates what UF Health says are administrative obstacles, including waiting on getting authorizations for certain procedures.
“This is a great thing for the patients who have been calling us and wanting to be seen,” said Dr. Marvin Dewar, the CEO of UF Health Physicians. “It’s a good thing for the community. It’s a good thing for our hospitals and our providers. So, it will be back to clinical care as usual for united patients, and I am happy about that.”
RELATED: UF Health, United Healthcare reach deal after months of negotiations
The new agreement starts May 5 and restores network access to all U-F Health hospitals, facilities, and physicians.
Click here to subscribe to our newsletter.

author: AGENCY
title: How Berliners are fighting to preserve their vast utopian park | The Star
text:
First-time visitors to the vast open area in the middle of Berlin often need a minute to take it all in.Stretching out before their eyes is a disused airfield that was constructed by the Nazis in the German capital's Tempelhof district long ago. After the former airport was shut down in 2008, the site was converted into the city's largest public park.
Where once planes took off, skaters and cyclists now speed along the two runways. Due to its vastness, Tempelholfer Feld (Tempelhofer Field) as the locals call it, is a popular spot for flying kites. Designated areas for barbecuing, which is prohibited on balconies and in many parks in Berlin, are crowded with families and groups of friends, especially on the weekends.
Tempelhofer Feld, which covers a total area of 300ha, is also a popular spot to watch the sunset and is home to an urban gardening collective, a beer garden and a theatre.
The only downside – the park gates are closed every day at sundown and visitors are shooed away by security guards once dusk has settled in.
In a city like Berlin, where rent and property prices have seen a massive surge over the last decade, a utopian space like this is bound to be contested.
Some 10 years ago, Berliners were asked to decide on the future of the area in a referendum. Some 64% voted in favour of a law preserving Tempelhofer Feld as a place of recreation. That also ruled out development in favour of housing.
Opponents of the law argued at the time that it would be irresponsible not to develop such a vast space in a city where finding an affordable flat is becoming more and more impossible.
A man doing a hand stand on a repurposed runway at Tempelholfer Feld.
Supporters of preserving Tempelhofer Feld in its original state pointed to other areas that they said should be developed first. Plus, they said, there was no guarantee the city government would build affordable social housing, fearing luxury apartments would sprout up instead.
A decade later, rent prices in Berlin have gone up even further and more and more people are calling for flats to be built on at least parts of the site.
Berlin's new state government, a coalition of the conservative Christian Democrats and the central-left Social Democrats, is looking to explore possibilities for "careful peripheral development in limited parts of the area", according to its coalition agreement.
Activists from the 100% Tempelhofer Feld citizens' initiative, which spearheaded the 2014 referendum, are alarmed at the prospect.
"It's never been as serious as it is now," Mareike Witt from the initiative said.
"The Tempelhofer Feld Act is practically the only law in force that was written directly by the people of Berlin," she says. The government plans to reconsider how the site is used in an attempt to torpedo the democratic process and undermine the law step by step, the activist believes.
The state parliament recently passed an amendment which allows the temporary expansion of an existing container village housing refugees next to the former airport terminal building.
Skaters and cyclists now speed along the two runways of Tempelholfer Feld.
According to the activists, expanding the accommodation is only a pretext for more far-reaching measures.
To prevent the development of the site, Witt and her fellow campaigners are currently gathering signatures for a petition to have Tempelhofer Feld added to the Unesco World Heritage List.
"An average of 200,000 visitors come to the park every week," Witt notes. On a Sunday with pleasant weather, visitors can sometimes reach up to 80,000, she adds.
"Tempelhofer Feld is becoming increasingly popular and has blossomed into a Berlin landmark."
The site's recreational value cannot be overestimated, Witt says.
Meanwhile, there is still enough available wasteland in Berlin to build the approximately 200,000 flats Berlin needs to combat its housing shortage by 2040, according to official estimates, the activist says.
Germany's Federation for the Environment and Nature Conservation (Bund) takes a similar view while pointing to the site's crucial role in the fight against climate change and nature protection.
Temperatures on Tempelhofer Feld drop to lower levels overnight than in the densely developed neighbourhoods surrounding it, Tilmann Heuser, managing director at Bund, says, a phenomenon that you will experience even cycling past the site at night.
Tempelhofer Feld allows for the formation of cold air flows which are immensely important for the climate of cities in times of global warming, allowing them to cool down again overnight, the expert says.
The vast area, which Heuser says is "atypical" for a metropolis the size of Berlin, is also home to several species, including the skylark.
Heuser says when it comes to plans to partially develop the site, an overall concept is missing.
Previous studies by urban planners, for example, have shown that residential development does not make sense on any of the site's edges due to existing infrastructure and conservation considerations.
The area is framed by its large former terminal building, which regularly hosts events and has long been designated as a monument to be preserved, Heuser says.
Berlin's minister for housing, Christian Gaebler, on the other hand, argues that "Tempelhofer Feld is one of the few areas in Berlin that is owned by the state and therefore offers an opportunity to build affordable housing for the common good of all sections of the population".
Gaebler advocates a mixed development of the area that includes both housing and social infrastructure as well as leisure and recreational areas.
Legally, the city parliament could simply amend the Tempelhofer Feld Act passed by the referendum to pave the way for the site's development.
Politically, such a step could be seen as a disregard for the democratic vote, which could be fatal for the two governing parties, especially at a time when the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) has been making huge gains amid discontent with the establishment.
Instead, the city government has initiated a process criticised by the citizens' initiative and Bund as "sham-citizen participation".
Initially, up to 275 people will be selected at random from 20,000 Berliners to take part in so-called dialogue workshops on the future of Tempelhofer Feld. They are to work out a blueprint for the future development of the site – without any predetermined ideas.
The results will later be used for a call for an international competition to present ideas for the use of the area.
Only then will politicians decide on potential housing on the site, though that is likely to come after the current term. – dpa

author: VNExplorer
title: Salt Lake City Revs Up E-Bike Incentive Program to Reduce Traffic and Boost Sustainability
text: Salt Lake City is taking a big step towards a more sustainable future with the launch of a new e-bike incentive program. This program aims to make e-bikes more accessible to residents, encouraging them to ditch their cars and embrace a greener mode of transportation. Inspired by Success Stories The program draws inspiration from similar initiatives in other cities like Denver, where resident discounts on e-bikes have proven wildly popular. Salt Lake City’s Mayor, Erin Mendenhall, believes e-bikes offer a multitude of benefits beyond environmental advantages. They can be a more affordable transportation option, especially as gas prices soar, and can provide a healthy and enjoyable way to get around for people with varying physical abilities. The Pilot Program This initial program is a pilot, funded with $200,000 from the city’s 2024 budget. Salt Lake City residents can apply online for a chance to win a rebate voucher worth $300 to $1,300. The specific amount depends on the applicant’s income and the type of e-bike they choose. Cargo and utility e-bikes are eligible for higher rebates due to their higher cost. Winners can redeem their vouchers at five participating bike shops within Salt Lake City. Looking to the Future The city is committed to improving cycling infrastructure in anticipation of a potential surge in e-bike ridership. Mendenhall highlighted the city’s ongoing efforts to build new bike lanes and improve existing ones. The program’s future iterations will depend on its success in this first round. However, the initial enthusiasm suggests a bright future for e-bikes in Salt Lake City. Businesses like Rad Power Bikes are eager to participate and hope the program will be expanded in the coming year.

author: Escrito por: América López
title: ¿Por qué el Día del Padre cambia cada año y no tiene una fecha fija?
text:
¿Ya tienes listos los regalos? El Día para festejar a los padres en México ya casi llega y aquí te contamos por qué no tiene una fecha fija, en qué día deberás felicitar a tu papá y además cuál es el origen.
¿Qué día es el Día del Padre en México en 2024? Para este año 2024, el Día del Padre se celebrará el próximo domingo 16 de junio. Cabe destacar que la celebración tiene lugar el tercer domingo del mes de junio , por lo que el día varía año con año. Cabe señalar que hay solo un estado en toda la República Mexicana que propuso celebrar este día en una fecha específica, siendo Baja California.
Mariana del Pilar Ávila Olmeda, gobernadora de la entidad, llegó al acuerdo de cambiar la fecha del Día del Padre al tercer viernes de junio, que en este año corresponde al viernes 21, con el propósito de que los padres trabajadores puedan descansar y disfrutar de este día con sus familias.
| X
¿Cuál es la historia del Día del Padre? La historia del Día del Padre se remonta a principios del siglo XX en Estados Unidos y se le atribuye a Sonora Smart Dodd, quien, inspirándose en el Día de la Madre, quería honrar a su padre, Henry Jackson Smart, quien era un veterano de la Guerra Civil estadounidense que crió a seis hijos solo después de la muerte de su esposa en el parto.
En 1924, el presidente Calvin Coolidge declaró oficialmente el Día del Padre como celebración nacional en Estados Unidos; sin embargo, este día también se festeja en otros países como Canadá, Colombia, Argentina, Chile, Perú, entre otros.
¿El Día del Padre es festivo oficial en México? El Día del padre no es considerado como festivo oficial dentro de la Ley Federal del Trabajo (LFT), pues los únicos días de descanso obligatorio son:
El 1 de enero El primer lunes de febrero en conmemoración del 5 de febrero El tercer lunes de marzo en conmemoración del 21 de marzo El 1 de mayo El 16 de septiembre El tercer lunes de noviembre en conmemoración del 20 de noviembre El 1 de diciembre de cada seis años, cuando corresponda a la transmisión del Poder Ejecutivo Federal 25 de diciembre El que determinen las leyes federales y locales electorales, en el caso de elecciones ordinarias, para efectuar la jornada electoral, como en este año que se llevaron a cabo las elecciones 2024 el pasado domingo 2 de junio . Días festivos ¡No te pierdas nuestro contenido, sigue a Fuerza Informativa Azteca en Google News! Publicado: 13/06/2024 | 🕑 14:37 Notas Tendencias Escrito por: América López Compartir Tweet
